title: False positive error from JavadocType with record
description:
I have read check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/checks/javadoc/javadoctype.html
I have downloaded the latest checkstyle from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run
I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words

/var/tmp $ cat MyTransaction.java package bkk; /** * One Transaction. * * @param transactionId unique ID of the transaction in format: {@code :} */ public record MyTransaction(String transactionId) { } /var/tmp $ java -Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US -jar checkstyle-10.12.1-all.jar -c config.xml MyTransaction.java Starting audit... [ERROR] D:\Projects\app4Test\checkstyle-test\src\main\java\bkk\MyTransaction.java:6:4: Unused @param tag for 'transactionId'. [JavadocType] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.">
/var/tmp $ javac YOUR_FILE.java

/var/tmp $ cat config.xml
<!DOCTYPE module PUBLIC
        "-//Puppy Crawl//DTD Check Configuration 1.3//EN"
        "http://www.puppycrawl.com/dtds/configuration_1_3.dtd">
<module name="Checker">
    <module name="TreeWalker">
        <module name="JavadocType">
            <property name="allowMissingParamTags" value="true"/>
            <property name="allowUnknownTags" value="true"/>
        </module>
    </module>
</module>

/var/tmp $ cat MyTransaction.java
package bkk;

/**
 * One Transaction.
 *
 * @param transactionId  unique ID of the transaction in format: {@code <first Code>:<second Code>}
 */
public record MyTransaction(String transactionId) {
}

/var/tmp $ java -Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US -jar checkstyle-10.12.1-all.jar -c config.xml MyTransaction.java
Starting audit...
[ERROR] D:\Projects\app4Test\checkstyle-test\src\main\java\bkk\MyTransaction.java:6:4: Unused @param tag for 'transactionId'. [JavadocType]
Audit done.
Checkstyle ends with 1 errors.

I expect no warning or errors here. Javadoc is properly written in the proper place.
